statement.p: The half-life of caffeine in the human body is about 5.8 hours. A cup of coffee has about 105 mg of caffeine.

li.p: Write an equation for the amount of caffeine in a person's body after drinking a cup of coffee? Let \displaystyle{C} be the milligrams of caffeine in the body after \displaystyle{t} hours. Â
How much caffeine will remain after 10 hours? mg. State your answer to the nearest hundredth of a mg.
How long until there are only 20 mg remaining? hours. State your answer to the nearest hundredth of an hour.
In \displaystyle{t}={10} hours there will be \displaystyle{C}={105}\cdot{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{10}}{{5.8}}}} mg.
Starting with 105 mg of caffeine and a half-life of 5.8 hours, this person's system will have about 31.78 mg after 10 hours.
Here we have to solve the equation \displaystyle{20}={105}\cdot{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{t}}{{5.8}}}}.
Then apply the \displaystyle{\log} to both sides.
Now bring the power down as a multiple of the right side.
Starting with 105 mg of caffeine and a half-life of 5.8 hours, there will be 20 mg remaining in this person's system after about 13.88 hours.
